fields.summary: VPCMIDO: Multiple Gateways: support multiple router peers

comments.body:
This is wonderful information that is nowhere to be found in the documentation.  Up until now I have had no clue to to configure multiple Gateways with the JSON file.  Am I missing something or does there need to be a DOC ticket to have these configuration examples included?

Also, does this work with 4.2.2 or is this multiple gateways a 4.3 specific feature?

Thanks.
[~jgallucci32], the ticket for multiple gateway support was EUCA-11149 (4.2), documentation tickets relating to multiple gateways are DOC-1710 DOC-1719 DOC-1792.

Hi

In 4.2 VPC I had two mido GW:s working and I tested the shutdown of one midogw server and that worked ok.
The json I used looked similar to this.
{
  "InstanceDnsServers": [
    "10.2.1.5"
  ],
  "Mode": "VPCMIDO",
  "PublicIps": [
    "10.9.0.1-10.9.0.250"
  ],
  "Mido": {
    "EucanetdHost": "clos820.cloud.net",
    "GatewayHost": "clos824.cloud.net",
    "GatewayIP": "10.10.14.6",
    "GatewayInterface": "eth1.319",
    "PublicNetworkCidr": "10.10.14.0/28",
    "PublicGatewayIP": "10.10.14.1"
  },
  "Mido": {
    "EucanetdHost": "clos820.cloud.net",
    "GatewayHost": "clos825.cloud.net",
    "GatewayIP": "10.10.15.6",
    "GatewayInterface": "eth1.318",
    "PublicNetworkCidr": "10.10.15.0/28",
    "PublicGatewayIP": "10.10.15.1"
  }
}

[~teejalon], Euca 4.2 and 4.3 have the same handling of multiple mido gateways, so if it was working on 4.2, it should work on 4.3.
However, when you have 2 "Mido" entries in network.json, only the last one is fully processed. Unless you have manually configured the gateways in MidoNet, Eucalyptus would not actuate both gateways. Perhaps you shutdown the inactive gateway?
Moving 4.4.0 Issues from Release Pending to Resolved
